titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the University of Chicago Lower Rickert House Records1972-2000
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by MP, 2019

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: University of Chicago. Lower Rickert House. Records

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Records, photographs and memorabilia from the University of Chicago Lower Rickert House, part of the Woodward Court residential hall that was demolished in 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: University of Chicago. Lower Rickert House. Records, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Lower Rickert House at the University of Chicago was part of the Woodward Court residential hall, completed in 1958 and demolished in 2001. Woodward Court was a residential hall for university undergraduates.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Lower Rickert House collection contains records, photographs, news clippings, and memorabilia from the Woodward Court residential hall from 1972-2000. The collection is organized chronologically and by object type.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources
relatedmaterial.p: The following related resources are located in the Department of Special Collections:

archref.unittitle: University of Chicago. Beecher House. Records
University of Chicago. Henderson House. Records
